examples: She gave him a frown and told him to mind his manners.

When I asked my friend for feedback on my presentation, she gave me some tough criticism, but I knew that a friend's frown is better than a fool's smile, so I took her advice and made some changes that ultimately improved the outcome.
Don't frown now.
I would just frown.
That clown is frowning and running at me with a tiny cream pie.
words.defineEn: an expression on the face in which the eyebrows are brought together in a way that causes lines above the eyes, which shows anger, worry, or disapproval
words.defineVi: một biểu hiện trên khuôn mặt trong đó lông mày được kéo lại với nhau theo cách gây ra các nếp nhăn phía trên mắt, thể hiện sự tức giận, lo lắng hoặc không tán thành

examples: Glaring round at the solitary embryo sheepskin, who quaked in his shoes.
I wear sunglasses to protect my eyes from the sun's glare.
Oh glare is killing us.
Shout out to Ready To Glare.
The search went on through the night, under the glare of floodlights and the watchful eye of anxious parents.
words.defineEn: a steady and sharp stare that conveys anger, disapproval, or hostility
words.defineVi: một cái nhìn ổn định và sắc nét truyền đạt sự tức giận, không tán thành hoặc thù địch

examples: She grimaced at the taste of the bitter medicine.
The child grimaced in pain as the doctor examined his injured arm.
As the comedian told the joke, the audience grimaced in a mixture of amusement and discomfort.
The teacher's stern grimace warned the students to behave.
She couldn't hide her grimace of disgust when she tasted the spoiled milk.
words.defineEn: a twisted facial expression indicating pain, disgust or disapproval
words.defineVi: nét mặt vặn vẹo thể hiện sự đau đớn, ghê tởm hoặc không tán thành

words.defineEn: a disappointed or sad facial expression
words.defineVi: một nét mặt thất vọng hoặc buồn bã

examples: But she's a little bit scary, she's a little bit of a badass, and she's always having that scowl on her face, which is me.
The last thing you will see as you succumb to an attack is the scars of a snarling, scowling face as she goes in for the kill.
But, hey: That doesn’t mean you should retire your well-practiced scowl, because studies also show that putting one on can help you perform better.
He said nothing and scowled which from him I'm told is a rave review, but then I mentioned that this particular coat also doubles as a dog bed and his face lit up.
words.defineEn: a sullen or angry frown signifying displeasure
words.defineVi: một cái cau mày ủ rũ hoặc tức giận biểu thị sự không hài lòng

examples: But even if we have to give Jupiter a little side-eye now and then, it could have helped make life on Earth possible.
words.defineEn: a sidelong glance or look given to someone, often indicating suspicion, disapproval, or contempt
words.defineVi: một cái liếc xéo hoặc cái nhìn dành cho ai đó, thường biểu thị sự nghi ngờ, không tán thành hoặc khinh miệt

examples: I didn't sleep a wink last night.
She winked at him, playfully closing one eye.
Our newborn son is rather colicky, so my wife and I haven't slept a wink the last few nights.

In a world where miscommunication can lead to misunderstandings and conflicts, it's important to be straightforward and avoid relying on subtle or indirect cues - as they say, a nod is as good as a wink to a blind horse.
And just like give a little wink.
words.defineEn: the act of opening and closing one eye quickly once as a sign of affection, greeting, etc.
words.defineVi: hành động mở và nhắm nhanh một mắt một lần như một dấu hiệu của tình cảm, lời chào, v.v.

examples: Spare his blushes.
The manager spoke for his young employee in order to spare her blushes.
Liam whispered sweet nothings into Jane's ear, making her blush and smile.
I tried saving her blushes when she asked me to prom by saying I had no intention of going with anyone.
The way he looked at her, his eyes on stalks, made her blush and feel desired.
words.defineEn: the rush of blood to the face signifying embarrassment, modesty or confusion
words.defineVi: máu dồn lên mặt biểu thị sự bối rối, khiêm tốn hoặc bối rối

examples: But, if the subject had been told that the injection would make him feel all pumped up, he'd actually report very little emotion, just because he was blaming that racing heart and flushed face on the drug, not a particular state of mind.

So the dude's just sitting there, jacked up on this hormone, and his heart is racing, and his cheeks are all flushed, and in the case where the subject was told not to expect the effects, the study found that the guy would actually adopt the emotion of the actor in the room, becoming happy or testy, depending on how the person was acting.
words.defineEn: (especially of the face) describing a reddened or rosy appearance resulting from increased blood flow or heightened emotion

examples: The afternoon sun casts a warm glow on the buildings and trees.

examples: Emmeline turned pale.

examples: -You're creasing between each wind.

examples: Yeah, he would just crumple.

examples: As that is happening, you have this furrow forming, this little indentation.

Now, at the same time telophase is happening, you also normally have this cytokinesis, where this cleavage furrow forms, where essentially-- during telophase, these things are getting pushed further and further apart by those microtubules so that they're already at the ends of the cell, of the cytoplasm of the cell, and you can almost view them as pushing on the sides to elongate the cell.
words.defineEn: to cause wrinkles or lines to appear on the skin as a sign of worry, confusion, or concentration

examples: Trade school as post-secondary education can be a ticket to a six-figure income, but it's sneered at by kids, parents and teachers alike.
